section.content: Things have been too quiet for Lupin fans, but July is about to turn that around... for the Japanese fans at least. We are (finally) back with another edition of Lupin news!

section.title: The 2004 special is...
section.content: finally here! The latest special will air on NTV's Golden Roadshow 30 July at 9:03PM in Japan. The title is roughly Lupin Was Stolen or Steal from Lupin. The plot revolves around Lupin stealing the cursed "Bulls Eye", as ransom for a kidnapped Fujiko. Fingers are crossed that an official site for the special will reveal more soon.

section.title: First TV series digitally remastered for rebroadcast
section.content:
The Japanese fans get a second helping of Lupin during the month of July. Wowow, a Japanese satellite TV provider, will be rebroadcasting the first TV series over the month of July. What makes this rebroadcast special is the fact that the series has been given a digital makeover. It has been enhanced for HD broadcasts and has been remastered for more accurate colors and other touch-ups.

Will this lead to another R2 box set release for the first series in Japan? My money is on "yes", but only time will tell.

links.title: Wowow's official page for the rebroadcast

section.title: And to top things off...
section.content: Japanese fans will also enjoy a brand new series from Monkey Punch starting in July. Mankatsu will feature a series of shorts that will build their stories with each episode. There appear to be a wide range of shorts from action to comedy and all are bear the distinctive Monkey Punch flair.

section.content: I hope the US side of Lupin fandom will have some news soon. For now, we will have to sigh and wish we lived in Japan. Be seeing you.
